bibl.title: Letter from A.F.A. King to William N. Hill, October 9, 1907

div1.p: King comments on the Maryland Club meeting and thanks Hill for some literature on drainage.

div1.head: Letter from A.F.A. King to William N. Hill, October 9, 1907
div1.opener:
DR. A. F. A. KING,
1315 MASSACHUSETTS AVENUE N. W.
TELEPHONE, NORTH 470.
OFFICE HOURS:
9 TO 10 A. M.
4 TO 5 P. M.
WASHINGTON, D. C. Oct 9 1907
Dr Wm. N. Hill,
My Dear Doctor,
div1.p:
I have written Dr.
Kelly that he ought to take the
Maryland Club or any other
kind of Club and beat me
blue for giving him so much
distress & worry. I made the
same mistake as yourself and
am thoroughly ashamed of it.

Well, I hope we shall do better
on the fourteenth, when I hope to
meet you again. Many thanks
for the literature on drainage & c
which I shall read with interest
